job_title: Program Coordinator in North Andover, MA
pros: Merrimack College has great benefits (holidays, health insurance, summer Fridays off, one free meal swipe per day, etc). There are lots of tuition remission opportunities for master’s programs. Great supervisors and colleagues.
cons: I don’t have any that come to mind right now.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Burlington, NJ
pros: Good people, great atmosphere, nice campus, good technology, great support
cons: I wish adjuncts could teach more than 2 classes, they expect a lot of work for the low pay in terms of what you need to report and how much hand-holding you need to give the students

review_title: I like working at this college.
job_title: Adjunct Professor in Orlando, FL
pros: Smallish school, since the lock down lunches have been free (after your initial purchase of a $5 plastic tray to carry your meals), Students hold the door for each other and for teachers, parking is not a problem. A student had presented a complaint about one the English teachers, but I loved the way the school handled it. They kept it anonymous, and the point person in the department spoke to everyone about it and reviewed ways to support the students.
cons: First semester pay was low, but it went up my second semester.

job_title: Associate Director in Somerset, NJ
pros: Health insurance is great. 403b retirement is awesome. Nice people. Great institution overall with a great trajectory
cons: Lack of opportunities for growth. Morale can also be low at times.

job_title: Student Security in La Mirada, CA
pros: - flexible hours - great work staff - training provided
cons: -can get a little hectic

job_title: Assistant Professor of Practice in Modesto, CA
pros: Culture of kindness and inclusion
cons: Small college with some financial worries

job_title: Student Worker in Andover, MA
pros: - Can get opportunities that relate to major
cons: - For student workers, can be hard to get a lot of hours for some jobs

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in North Andover, MA
pros: One free meal a day.
cons: Dean of the college was not supportive of adjuncts.

job_title: Lecturer in North Andover, MA
pros: Small community where you can work closely with students.
cons: The college is making efforts to improve it's diversity.

job_title: Assistant Director in North Andover, MA
pros: Great company to work for. The benefits are great. Time off is great! Maternity leave benefits are AMAZING!
cons: I have nothing negative to say about the college

job_title: Project Coordinator in North Andover, MA
pros: The school community is strong and it's a great place to work.
cons: The workload is heavy but manageable.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Andover, MA
pros: Great facilities and opportunities to teach graduate level students. Students were motivated.
cons: Rigor of courses varied greatly within a department based on who was teaching it.

review_title: Great place to work for an on-campus student
job_title: Peer Advisor in North Andover, MA
pros:
- positive work environment
- gain customer service experience
- gain professional experience 
- convenient for an on-campus student
cons: Hours can be limited sometimes because of class/other conflicts on campus.

job_title: Associate Professor in North Andover, MA
pros: Decent students and work with many others who genuinely care for the student's well being.
cons: Extremely slow to change. Only one person at the college can make decisions.

job_title: Senior Assistant Vice President Operations in North Andover, MA
pros: Competitive compensation, great benefits, positive work environment, opportunity for growth and development, hybrid friendly.
cons: I really don't have anything "con" to report!

job_title: Lecturer in Boston, MA
pros: Good arts facility with space
cons: don't have any cons yet

job_title: Manager in North Andover, MA
pros: Holidays, growing college, amazing culture / colleagues
cons: Lacks an organizational structure in regards to promotions, raises, job titles etc. Some inequity between faculty and staff

job_title: Student Worker in North Andover, MA
pros: Relax work culture and salary is good for student workers.
cons: In pandemics, there were few opportunities.

job_title: Master Student in Boston, MA
pros: Flexible Schedule, Low hours, Good pay
cons: I believe that there are no cons

review_title: Help patrons with anything and everything within the library on campus
job_title: Student Library Assistant in North Andover, MA
pros: I attended school here for 4 years and it was awesome to have an on campus job.
cons: I do not have any negative thoughts for working at Merrimack College.

job_title: Content Creator in Boston, MA
pros: Friendly people on a sincere mission to help students. Accomodating work environment.
cons: Leadership can be fickle at times.

job_title: Student Building Manager in Menlo Park, CA
pros: On-campus job that has sufficient pay
cons: restricted hours from student employment

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Seekonk, MA
pros: Gave me a job opportunity while attending school
cons: Do not get paid enough for all the work students do

job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Andover, MA
pros: Great way to get opportunities in your major and make connections. Many jobs can be completed remotely
cons: Some positions can be competitive

job_title: Special Agent, Homeland Security Investigations in Buffalo, NY
pros: Welcoming environment and safe environment
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Graduate Fellow in North Andover, MA
pros: Connections with faculty and staff
cons: Not any to report at the moment

job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Andover, MA
pros: Good food, good atmosphere, great education, beautiful campus.
cons: I have no cons for this institution.

job_title: Head Coach in North Andover, MA
pros: Fun to work in university environment
cons: They pay poorly and provide no opportunities for advancement.

review_title: It is a good job, just do not expect to be rewarded and do not ever think you deserve to be.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in North Andover, MA
pros: The students and coworkers are fantastic, friendly, and welcoming people. Fantastic paid holiday schedule.
cons: No internal growth. They tend to hire far too many VP's and upper level management but no support. If they hire support, they tend to post positions geared toward a particular person from outside the campus. There is no internal posting system or job grading system. Staff support is touted as the face of the campus yet are not compensated as such.

review_title: Great place to work, low key and lots of things to do in the area.
job_title: Teacher in Andover, MA
pros: Nice people, beautiful campus, supportive administration, nice students. Students are hard workers and the people who work with you are eager to help when you need it.
cons: Not too close to Boston.  Not a particularly diverse group of students, if that is what you are looking for. Very traditional Catholic campus, which could be either a pro or a con, depending upon how you look at it.  Campus is growing faster than they are posting jobs.

review_title: OK place to work if you just need a job
job_title: in North Andover, MA
pros: It's a close-knit, community atmosphere, good location and comparable benefits. Some departments run very well, which helps others run well.
cons: If you are not in the 'In crowd', you will never be promoted or given more than your alloted 3% raise. If you are fine just having a job and don't have much ambition, this is a good place to be a lifer.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in North Andover, MA
pros: I found the fellow staff members to be friendly, particularly the department secretary; I enjoyed the students
cons: Low, low pay for time put in; very little guidance from above, as the main issue I had teaching (I assigned too much reading) was one of the specific points I asked the department chair when preparing my syllabus.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in North Andover, MA
pros: Wonderful and diverse staff and student body, and the college goes out of its way to make a sense of community. The administration also does well in looking out for its employees, even term faculty.
cons: The college May not have a grad program or enough resources for research. But that really depends on the department.

review_title: At Merrimack College I was able to have my eyes opened to how business are done.
job_title: Area Manager in North Andover, MA
pros: The work environment is very friendly and also you get to know very important people and how to deal with them.
cons: Sometimes the hours are very extensive and employees can get fed up with one another during events where they need to be relaxed.

job_title: Resident Advisor in North Andover, MA
pros: Community is fantastic. It's the reason people go, the reason they stay, and the reason they don't leave. It's what makes Merrimack great.
cons: Bureaucratic at times. Which is to be expected with any large organization. Particularly a college. Not everyone is on the same page always.

job_title: Peer Coordinator in North Andover, MA
pros:
-all about community
-great work-life balance
-amazing people
cons:
-pay is probably not on the high end considering it's higher ed
-can be clique-y
-in the middle of north andover, where there isn't a lot to do (however, this is also speaking from a former student perspective as well)

review_title: Great for helping with professional development
job_title: Assistant Director of Student Success in North Andover, MA
pros:
Great to take on new job skills and learn 
Help a lot with professional development
Multiple Fridays off in the summer
cons: There is a general culture of burnout - not a commitment to caring for yourself as an employee

job_title: Student Worker in North Andover, MA
pros: When working at the McQuade Library the pros were the hours, atmosphere and location.
cons: Some of the challenges working here were non existent, unless you worked the night shift which means stocking books.

job_title: in Hampton, NH
pros: The people are great and you really get to know the people you are working with.
cons: It can sometimes get boring, but when it's busy in your specific office, you are completely busy.

review_title: Not a great place to work
job_title: Leadership Team in North Andover, MA
pros: If you live north of Boston you will have an easy commute since located near Route 93 and Route 495. They offer a generous number of paid holidays.
cons: The top leaders could greatly benefit from an effective executive coach to work on their ability to build employee engagement.

job_title: Box Office Intern in North Andover, MA
pros: Great experience and learned a lot about college sports!
cons: Management doesn't seem to have a lot of expereience

job_title: Senior Marketing Associate / Marketing Manager in North Andover, MA
pros: Great networking opportunities with faculty and staff
cons: Poor pay, no advancement opportunities

job_title: Van Driver in Boston, MA
pros: communication, driving skills, needs to pay attention
cons: short shifts, old vans, stop vans during the covid

job_title: Recreation Supervisor in North Andover, MA
pros: Make my own schedule, Pick who i want to work with
cons: Late nights, short shifts, so so

job_title: Supplemental Instructions (SI) Leader in North Andover, MA
pros: Flexible hours and lots of support
cons: Have to constantly be preparing for the next session

job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Andover, MA
pros: Institution that cares about their staff, faculty, and students
cons: Takes time to move up

job_title: Building Manager in North Andover, MA
pros: Great job and good hours
cons: I have no Cons about this position

job_title: Tutor in North Andover, MA
pros: Great professors to work with
cons: no cons everything was great

job_title: Student Worker in North Andover, MA
pros: Good Pay, Flexible Shifts, Learn A Lot
